between Merkle verification and Escrow payments  Flow: 1. Sponsor creates milestone \u2192 commits Merkle root 2. Sponsor funds escrow (with/without yield) 3. Contributors work on submilestones 4. Contributors submit PR via platform 5. AI analyzes PR \u2192 decides if should merge 6. Backend calls approvePayout() if AI approves 7. approvePayout(string,bool).details: Called by authorized backend service after AI analyzes PR

params.approved: AI decision (true = merge PR, false = reject)

batchApprovePayout(string[],bool[]).details: Gas-efficient for processing multiple PRs at once

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

getMilestonePayouts(string,string).notice: Get all payout requests for a milestone

isVerifier(address).notice: Check if address is authorized verifier
